Description: Glazed composition female figure, standing upright with legs together, and hands flat at sides. Back pillar with lateral piercing for suspension at breast level. Head broken away at back, and the leg section below thighs. Glaze creamy off white, with small porosities, with black-brown on pubic area, in semi-circular shape now flaked off. Badly abraded on breasts and pubic area.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: First Temple of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ5 (top level of 'bothros' / 'trench with bowls')
Curator's comments: Marked with Alpha Pi in Greek letters to indicate Apollo Sanctuary.
Bibliographic references: Webb 1978 / Archaic Greek Faience, Miniature scent bottles and related objects from East Greece, 650-500BC (no. 329, p. 84)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. II, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.24)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
